physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal neurologic examination results except for difficulty in tandem gait that predated the use of phenytoin.
Normal results on EEG recording and brain MRI.

EEG showed multiple seizures occurring during stage 2 sleep, with electrical seizures characterized by version of the head to the left, posturing of upper extremities, and displaying increased theta activity without focal onset.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, seizures occurred every 60 seconds lasting 6-8 seconds; after applying a nicotine patch, there was almost complete resolution of clinical and electrical events, and increased duration of slow-wave and REM sleep.
